original: brtag nus pa gang yin pa de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa yod na rang bzhin tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtag nus pa gang yin pa de yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i mkhyen pa yod na rang bzhin tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And whatever is capable of being conceived is related to mere nature, when there is the knowledge of the Omniscient One.

original: dngos su rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa de ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos su rnam par shes pa'i gzung ba gang yin pa de ni mngon du byed pa'i rnam par shes pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Whatever is the object of consciousness is the cause of the production of the consciousness that perceives it,

original: skyed byed ma yin pa ni gzung bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed byed ma yin pa ni gzung bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that what is not a cause of production is an object.

original: des na ji srid du shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pa'i ye shes mi dgag pa de srid du rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa'i rang bzhin don byed mi nus par brjod par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na ji srid du shes bya mtha' dag la khyab pa'i ye shes mi dgag pa de srid du rnam par rtog pas yul du byas pa'i rang bzhin don byed mi nus par brjod par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, as long as there is no knowledge that pervades all objects of knowledge, one cannot say that the nature that is the object of conceptualization is incapable of performing a function.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bzlog pa'i tshad ma yang gzhan la med la sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bzlog pa'i tshad ma yang gzhan la med la sgrub par byed pa ni yod pa yin no //
translated: The valid cognition that refutes omniscient consciousness also does not exist for others, but the proof does exist.

original: des na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de yang don byed pa mi srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin de yang don byed pa mi srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is essenceless is not impossible to perform a function.

original: des na rgyu tha dad pas don bya ba tha dad par 'gyur gyi rgyu tha dad pas don byed pa gtan med par ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na rgyu tha dad pas don bya ba tha dad par 'gyur gyi rgyu tha dad pas don byed pa gtan med par ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, because the causes are different, the performance of functions will be different, but because the causes are different, the performance of functions will not be completely nonexistent,

original: rang bzhin tsam la gnas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi dngos po bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin tsam la gnas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul gyi dngos po bzlog par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mere nature of that which is present cannot be refuted by the object of omniscient consciousness.

original: des na don bya ba mtha' dag med na rang bzhin dang 'gal ba rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don bya ba mtha' dag med na rang bzhin dang 'gal ba rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, if all performance of functions did not exist, it would be essenceless, because it would be contradictory to its essence.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs @253b pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin nyid ldog pa na don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs @253b pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las khyad par can gyi rang bzhin nyid ldog pa na don bya ba byed pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: Since the observation of a contradictory essence refutes the essence that is the opposite of the discordant factor, because it is pervaded by the performance of a function, it is a reason of essence.

original: de bas na don byed pa'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don byed pa'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur gyi dngos po med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a functional thing, not a non-thing.

original: dngos po'i phyogs kyang de nyid gzhan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das so //
analyzed: dngos po'i phyogs kyang de nyid gzhan nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa las ma 'das so //
translated: The position of a thing also does not go beyond the conceptual dichotomy of identity and difference.

original: des na dngos po med pa rang bzhin dang bral bka'i ngo bo mtha' dag gis stong ba'i rang bzhin can rnam par brtag pa la ni bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po med pa rang bzhin dang bral bka'i ngo bo mtha' dag gis stong ba'i rang bzhin can rnam par brtag pa la ni bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, in the case of a non-thing, which is devoid of intrinsic reality and is empty of all essential natures, activity is untenable.

original: dngos po med pa byed do zhes bya bas ni bya ba dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dgag pa dang lan cig 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa byed do zhes bya bas ni bya ba dngos po med pa dang 'brel pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir dgag pa dang lan cig 'brel pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone makes a non-thing‚Äù is a negation, because it is untenable that activity is related to a non-thing.

original: de lta yin dang 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po mi byed do zhes bya bas 'di dag gi don du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'jig pa'i rgyus dngos po mi byed do zhes bya bas 'di dag gi don du rnam par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, the statement ‚Äúthe cause of destruction does not make a thing‚Äù would be established as the meaning of these .

original: mi byed pa'i byed pa po de yang rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: mi byed pa'i byed pa po de yang rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Moreover, that non-making agent is not a cause, because it is not a cause. Therefore, there is no cause of destruction at all.

original: gzhan yang gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po ci rang bzhin gyi rgyu las ldog pa'i chos can du skyes sam /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhig par bya ba'i dngos po ci rang bzhin gyi rgyu las ldog pa'i chos can du skyes sam /
translated: Moreover, in regard to the thing to be destroyed, does it arise as a phenomenon that is the opposite of its cause?üîΩIf it does, then it is born as a phenomenon that endures.

original: 'o na te gnas pa'i chos can du skyes rtog pa dang po la ni dngos po ldog pa'i chos nyid kyis rang nyid kho na 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed do //
analyzed: 'o na te gnas pa'i chos can du skyes rtog pa dang po la ni dngos po ldog pa'i chos nyid kyis rang nyid kho na 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed do //
translated: In the first case, since the thing itself is destroyed by the nature of the phenomenon that is the opposite of the thing, the cause of destruction does not perform any function at all.

original: 'o na te dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi ldog pa'i chos yin na de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu brgya lhags kyang de'i bdag nyid las mi 'pho ba'i phyir gzhig par mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'o na te dngos po rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mi ldog pa'i chos yin na de ni 'jig pa'i rgyu brgya lhags kyang de'i bdag nyid las mi 'pho ba'i phyir gzhig par mi nus pas 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad kyang mi byed pa kho na'o //
translated: If the thing is by its very nature a phenomenon that does not cease, then even if a hundred causes of destruction were to come together, it would not move from its nature and therefore it could not be destroyed. Thus the cause of destruction does not perform any function at all.

original: 'di snyam du rang gi rgyu dag la ltos nas 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos par skye bas na ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad par de srid du gnas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rang gi rgyu dag la ltos nas 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos par skye bas na ji srid 'jig pa'i rgyu dang ma phrad par de srid du gnas so zhe na /
translated: If you think that because it arises in dependence on its own causes, it depends on the cause of destruction, and as long as it does not encounter the cause of destruction, it endures,

original: de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: that is also untenable.

original: 'di ltar phyogs 'di ltar ni dngos po rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu nye pa'i dus tshun chad du gnas par rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyogs 'di ltar ni dngos po rnams 'jig pa'i rgyu nye pa'i dus tshun chad du gnas par rgyus bskyed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the cause of the destruction of things produces their persistence for a little while.

original: de lta yin dang 'jig pa la dus cung zad ltos par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'jig pa la dus cung zad ltos par byed pa yin no //
translated: If that were so, then destruction would depend on a little time.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba na yang dus cung zad gnas pa'i chos can rnams la dus cung zad gnas pa'i sngar gyi rang bzhin yod dam 'o na te med //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu nye ba na yang dus cung zad gnas pa'i chos can rnams la dus cung zad gnas pa'i sngar gyi rang bzhin yod dam 'o na te med //
translated: Even when the cause of destruction is near, things that have the property of persisting for a little while have a prior nature that persists for a little while.

original: gal te yod do zhe na ni yang dus cung zad gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yod do zhe na ni yang dus cung zad gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does not exist, then it would persist for a little while.

original: dus de rdzogs kyang rang bzhin de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de rdzogs kyang rang bzhin de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even when that time is completed, that very nature would not exist.

original: rnam grangs 'dis kyang dus cung zad gnas par 'gyur bas nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs 'dis kyang dus cung zad gnas par 'gyur bas nam yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By this method, it would persist for a little while, and it would never be destroyed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rang gi rgyu las dus cung @254a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dngos po rang gi rgyu las dus cung @254a * //
translated: For that very reason, a thing would not persist for a little while due to its own cause.

original: zad gnas nas 'jig par 'gyur gyi skyes ma thag tu ni ma yin no zhes kun brtags pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs 'di yang mi rigs so //
analyzed: zad gnas nas 'jig par 'gyur gyi skyes ma thag tu ni ma yin no zhes kun brtags pa gang yin pa de'i phyogs 'di yang mi rigs so //
translated: But the assertion that it endures until it is destroyed is untenable.

original: 'di ltar mtshams su gyur pa'i dus rdzogs pa na slar yang dus cung zad gnas pa'i rang bzhin la brgal zhing brtag pa de nyid gnas pa'i phyir dngos po nam yang mi 'jig par 'gyur bas tshul 'di dngos po rtag par khas blang bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Since the very same argument and analysis that was applied to the time of the transition to another state is applicable to the time when it endures for a little while, things would never be destroyed. Therefore, this theory would entail the eternalism of things.

original: 'on te yang dus kyi mtshams kyi mthar thug par rang bzhin gzhan skyes nas de lta na ni sngar gyi dngos po la ci 'di rtag pa yin nam 'on te mi rtag pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te yang dus kyi mtshams kyi mthar thug par rang bzhin gzhan skyes nas de lta na ni sngar gyi dngos po la ci 'di rtag pa yin nam 'on te mi rtag pa yin zhes brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: But if another nature arises at the end of the time of the transition to another state, then the previous thing would have to be analyzed and questioned: is it permanent or impermanent?

original: gal te phyis rang bzhin rang nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de la 'jig pa'i rgyu 'am 'jig pa'i dus la bsdad pas ci bya /
analyzed: gal te phyis rang bzhin rang nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin na de la 'jig pa'i rgyu 'am 'jig pa'i dus la bsdad pas ci bya /
translated: If it is later destroyed, and its nature is characterized by cessation, then what is the use of a cause of destruction or the time of destruction?

original: 'on te mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin na de lta na yang de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag gam 'jig pa'i dus la ltos pas ci yang byar med do //
analyzed: 'on te mi 'jig pa'i chos nyid yin na de lta na yang de la 'jig pa'i rgyu dag gam 'jig pa'i dus la ltos pas ci yang byar med do //
translated: But if it is the intrinsic reality of non-disintegration, then in that case, it would not be the case that the causes of disintegration or the time of disintegration do anything to it.

original: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu dag ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i rgyu dag ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the causes of disintegration do not do anything at all.

original: dper na sa bon myu gu mngon par 'du byed pa ma yin yang myu gu'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du tho ba la sogs pa yang gzhig par bya ba mngon par 'du mi byed par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zlog par byed pa'i
analyzed: dper na sa bon myu gu mngon par 'du byed pa ma yin yang myu gu'i rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du tho ba la sogs pa yang gzhig par bya ba mngon par 'du mi byed par rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las zlog par byed pa'i
translated: For example, even though a seed does not produce the sprout, it becomes the cause of the sprout. In the same way, even though a hammer, etc. does not produce the object to be destroyed, it becomes the cause of the destruction of the object through the relation of invariable concomitance and the relation of the reversal of the object.

original: dngos por rigs pa rnams ldog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos por rigs pa rnams ldog pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /

translated: In this way, the sprout that is to be produced has no intrinsic reality at all at the time of its production, in regard to which one could conceive of it as being produced or not being produced.

analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo myu gu la sogs pa skyed par rung bar gyur pa na snga na med pa'i myu gu skyed par byed do //

translated: When the thing to be destroyed is in the process of being destroyed, the hammer, etc. exist with their own entities and the thing to be destroyed also exists with its own entity. Therefore, it is inevitable that the occasion for the

original: skabs yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skabs yod par 'gyur te /
translated: critique would exist.üîΩWhat is the occasion for the critique?

original: ci 'di rang gi ngo bos ldog pa'i chos nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di rang gi ngo bos ldog pa'i chos nyid yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúDoes this have the nature of cessation by its own intrinsic reality?

analyzed: ci thob la sogs pa 'di cung zhig byed pas na ldog par byed pa yin nam /
translated: Does this hammer, etc. cause cessation because it does something?üîΩOr does it not do anything?‚Äù

analyzed: de ste ci yang mi byed ces gzhig par bya ba'i dngos pa la gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa gnyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: These two conceptual thoughts occur in regard to the thing to be destroyed.

analyzed: bskyed par bya ba la ni ngo bo med @254b pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i go skabs med do //
translated: But since that which is to be produced has no intrinsic reality, there is no opportunity for conceptual thought.

translated: And just as with that which is to be produced, so it is with that which is to be destroyed, since we see that it follows the same pattern of positive and negative concomitance.

analyzed: tho ba la sogs pa ldog par byed pa yin no zhes smras ba gang yin pa de yang mi rigs te /

translated: For, in the case of the hammer and so on, is it the positive concomitance and negative concomitance with the production of the state of being a shard? Or is it the production of the state of having disintegration of the pot and so on?

analyzed: yang na ldog pa tsam sgrub ces the tshom za ba'o //

translated: The position of our own school is that the state of being a shard is produced from the vase, which is the appropriator that depends on the cooperating conditions such as the hammer.

original: des na ji ltar thob la sogs pa cung zad byed pa ma yin yang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams la cung zad mi byed pa yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba
analyzed: des na ji ltar thob la sogs pa cung zad byed pa ma yin yang 'jig pa'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du skad cig ma ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams la cung zad mi byed pa yang lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba

original: de la gal te sa bon lan cig byed pa dag gis khyad par du ma byas pa mu gu dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par dang po'i bye brag sgrub par nus pa yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir mu gu skyed pa la yang lhan cigüîΩbyed pa dag gis phan ma byas pa nyid nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te sa bon lan cig byed pa dag gis khyad par du ma byas pa mu gu dang rjes su mthun pa'i khyad par dang po'i bye brag sgrub par nus pa yin na ni khyad par med pa'i phyir mu gu skyed pa la yang lhan cig byed pa dag gis phan ma byas pa nyid nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seed, not distinguished by a single action, is able to produce the distinction of the first moment in conformity with the sprout, then, since there is no distinction, the seed, not assisted by the auxiliaries, would be able to produce the sprout.

original: de ste myu gu skyed pa khan cig byed pas phan byas pa la ltos pa yin na khyad par dang po skye ba la yang de ltar 'gyur ro //üîΩskyes pa nas brtsams te gtan du sa la sogs pa @255a * //
analyzed: de ste myu gu skyed pa khan cig byed pas phan byas pa la ltos pa yin na khyad par dang po skye ba la yang de ltar 'gyur ro // skyes pa nas brtsams te gtan du sa la sogs pa @255a * //
translated: If the seed is able to produce the sprout only when it is assisted by the auxiliaries, then the first moment of the seed would be like that.

original: sa bon la phan 'dogs par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon la phan 'dogs par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not possible for the earth, etc. to assist the seed permanently, beginning from the moment of its production,

original: nges pa'i dus su skye ba'i myu gu las thams cad kyi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i dus su skye ba'i myu gu las thams cad kyi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sprout would arise at all times, since it would have arisen at the proper time.

original: 'di ltar gal te gang yang rung ba na gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa dag gis sa bon dang myu gu la phan 'dogs par nus pa yin nas la sogs pa dang sa bon thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir sa bon gyi zhing la sogs pas byas
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te gang yang rung ba na gnas pa'i sa la sogs pa dag gis sa bon dang myu gu la phan 'dogs par nus pa yin nas la sogs pa dang sa bon thams cad kyi tshe yod pa'i phyir sa bon gyi zhing la sogs pas byas
translated: Thus, if the field of seeds and so on is able to benefit the seed and sprout, then the field of seeds and so on would exist at all times, since it is always able to benefit the seed and sprout.üîΩ

original: pa'i phan pa thams cad kyi tshe yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i phan pa thams cad kyi tshe yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the field and so on, which exist at any time, are able to assist the seed and sprout, then all the assistance provided by the field of the seed and so on would exist at all times, because the field and so on exist at all times.

original: de lta yin dang de'i phan pa brgyud pa las byung ba'i myu gu'i zla ba'i mthar thug par skye ba 'am /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de'i phan pa brgyud pa las byung ba'i myu gu'i zla ba'i mthar thug par skye ba 'am /
translated: If that were so, then the sprout would arise at the end of the month,

original: lo phyed kyi mthar thug par skye ba'am /
analyzed: lo phyed kyi mthar thug par skye ba'am /
translated: or it would arise at the end of half a year,üîΩor it would arise at the end of a year, arising in every way from the assistance of the field and so on.

original: lo'i mthar thug par skye ba'i rnam pa thams cad du rang gi dus tshigs su gtan 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: lo'i mthar thug par skye ba'i rnam pa thams cad du rang gi dus tshigs su gtan 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: des na sa bon gyi zhin la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa'i gtan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sa bon gyi zhin la sogs pas byas pa'i phan pa'i gtan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the assistance provided by the field of the seed and so on does not exist at all times.

original: de med pa'i phyir khyad par dang po skye ba na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir khyad par dang po skye ba na lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen la ltos par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Because that is not so, the first arising of a specific thing does not depend on a cooperative condition.

original: de bzhin du myu gu skye ba la yang ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du myu gu skye ba la yang ltos par bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the arising of a sprout would not depend on a cooperative condition.

original: de ltar yin dang skad cig ma rnams kyi don bya ba yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos par mi 'thad do //üîΩ'di snyam du khyad par gyi sa bon dang po skye ba la ni phan tshun nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen dag gis bye brag sgrub par byed la myu gu bskyed pa la ni zhing la sogs pa dag gis so snyam na de la yang sa bon gyi nye
analyzed: de ltar yin dang skad cig ma rnams kyi don bya ba yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos par mi 'thad do // 'di snyam du khyad par gyi sa bon dang po skye ba la ni phan tshun nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen dag gis bye brag sgrub par byed la myu gu bskyed pa la ni zhing la sogs pa dag gis so snyam na de la yang sa bon gyi nye
translated: If that were so, the function of the momentary things would not be tenable as depending on a cooperative condition.üîΩIf you think that the first arising of a specific seed is established by the cooperative conditions of mutual contact and that the production of a sprout is established by the cooperative conditions of a field, water, and so on, then also in that case, the cooperative conditions of the seed are not the capacity to assist the seed.

original: bar 'du pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de dag gi sa bon la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang ma yin no zhes rkyen gzhan dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: bar 'du pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de dag gi sa bon la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang ma yin no zhes rkyen gzhan dag gis bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: The cooperative conditions of the seed are established by other conditions.

original: de dag gi yang nye bar tshogs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag gis yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yang nye bar tshogs pa'i rkyen gzhan dag gis yin pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the conditions that are the assembly of those are other, so there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'bras bu re re bskyed pa la phan tshun nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen tshad med pa sgrub par nus pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu re re bskyed pa la phan tshun nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen tshad med pa sgrub par nus pa yang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: And it is not possible to establish an unlimited number of conditions that assemble in order to produce each effect.

original: 'di la brjod pa 'bras bu'i rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa 'bras bu'i rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In response to this, we say: There are two types of effects.

original: gcig ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag brgyud ba las skye ba'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni lhan cig byed pa dag gis byas pa'i khyad par gyi bye brag brgyud ba las skye ba'i chos can yin la /
translated: One is a phenomenon that arises from a specific transformation that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: gnyis pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par la mi ltos par skye ba can yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni lhan cig byed pa'i khyad par la mi ltos par skye ba can yin no //
translated: The second is a phenomenon that arises without depending on a specific transformation that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: de la myu gu ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par brgyud pa las skye ba'i chos nyid yin la khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par la mi ltos par @255b skyed pa'i chos nyid yin no //üîΩsa bon ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la myu gu ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par brgyud pa las skye ba'i chos nyid yin la khyad par dang po ni lhan cig byed pas byas pa'i khyad par la mi ltos par @255b skyed pa'i chos nyid yin no //üîΩsa bon ni rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rung ste /
translated: A sprout is a phenomenon that arises from a specific transformation that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions. The first transformation is a phenomenon that arises without depending on a specific transformation that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.üîΩA seed is a phenomenon that arises from a specific transformation that is produced by the assemblage of causes and conditions.

original: 'bras bu res 'ga' byed pa na rgyud gzhan dag gis khyad par byas pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu res 'ga' byed pa na rgyud gzhan dag gis khyad par byas pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When the effect is produced occasionally, it is produced by the other causes that are its auxiliaries, not by anything else.

original: rgyud gzhan ni res 'ga' 'bras bu skyed pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhan ni res 'ga' 'bras bu skyed pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen gang yin pa de dag yin te /
translated: The other causes are the auxiliaries that occasionally produce the effect.

original: dper na myu gu bskyed par bya ba zhing la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa rnams sa bon gyi nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na myu gu bskyed par bya ba zhing la sogs pa lhan cig byed pa rnams sa bon gyi nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the auxiliaries such as the field, etc., that produce the sprout are the cause of the seed‚Äôs capacity to produce the sprout.

original: res 'ga' ni lhan cig byed par de dag 'du ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag nyid nus pa zad pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni lhan cig byed par de dag 'du ba'i rgyu gang yin pa de dag nyid nus pa zad pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: Sometimes, the very causes that assemble the auxiliaries are the cause of the exhaustion of the capacity.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par dang po skye ba la nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen rnams nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no /
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i khyad par dang po skye ba la nye bar 'du ba'i rkyen rnams nus pa sad pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no /
translated: For example, the conditions that assemble the seed, etc., at the beginning of the production of the sprout are the cause of the seed‚Äôs capacity to produce the sprout.

original: rnam pa thams cad ni sa bon gyi rgyu gzhan gyi sa nus pa kho na 'bras bu'i khyad par res 'ga' bar byed pa rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ni sa bon gyi rgyu gzhan gyi sa nus pa kho na 'bras bu'i khyad par res 'ga' bar byed pa rtsom pa yin no //
translated: In all cases, the other causes of the effect, i.e., the seed, etc., are the cause of the production of the effect, i.e., the sprout, etc., from the particular capacity.

original: nus pa sad pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
analyzed: nus pa sad pa'i rgyu ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two causes of the awakening of potency:

original: lhan cig byed pa dang nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen no //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dang nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen no //
translated: the cooperative cause and the condition of assembly.

original: gang yang nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen tshad med pa dag bstan par bya dgos so zhes smras pa de la yang nye bar 'du ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang yang nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen tshad med pa dag bstan par bya dgos so zhes smras pa de la yang nye bar 'du ba'i rgyu rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: As for the claim that the condition of assembly must be taught as being immeasurable, there are two types of causes of assembly:

original: snga na med pa skyes pa dang / yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: snga na med pa skyes pa dang / yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa'o //
translated: that which arises without having existed previously and that which comes from another place.

original: re zhig gang du nga na med pa skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu dag kho na las nus pa skye ba yin no //
analyzed: re zhig gang du nga na med pa skyes pa gang yin pa de dag ni rang gi rgyu dag kho na las nus pa skye ba yin no //
translated: That which arises without having existed previously arises from its own causes alone.üîΩThat which comes from another place generates potency through its own cause of attraction alone. Why imagine the condition of assembly to be immeasurable?

original: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa gnag yin pa de dag rang 'gugs pa'i rgyu kho nas nus pa skyed pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen tshad med par brtag pa ci zhig bya des na skad cig ma rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: yul gzhan nas 'ongs pa gnag yin pa de dag rang 'gugs pa'i rgyu kho nas nus pa skyed pa yin pa'i phyir nye bar 'du pa'i rkyen tshad med par brtag pa ci zhig bya des na skad cig ma rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin /
translated: Thus, the condition of assembly does not assist the momentary factors.

original: yang 'bras bu'i khyad par la la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'thad la /
analyzed: yang 'bras bu'i khyad par la la lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen 'thad la /
translated: Some specific effects are tenable as the cooperative conditions of their causes.

original: 'bras bu la la ni phan pa sgrub pa gtsor byed pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: 'bras bu la la ni phan pa sgrub pa gtsor byed pa nyid do zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: and some results are established as primarily accomplishing benefit.

original: gang yang pha rol bos yod pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dag pa ni ma grub la /
analyzed: gang yang pha rol bos yod pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dag pa ni ma grub la /
translated: Moreover, the reason ‚Äúbecause it exists‚Äù that the opponent states is not established.

original: rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa la 'gal ba yin no zhes gzhan sras pa gang yin pa de yang dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni mi rtag pa la 'gal ba yin no zhes gzhan sras pa gang yin pa de yang dpyad par bya'o //
translated: And the contradiction between permanence and being related to impermanence should be analyzed in another way.

original: 'di la tshad ma ni thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma ni thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: Here, a valid cognition is that which causes attainment.

original: thob par byed pa yang don byed nus pa'i dngos po la 'jig par byed pa yid do //
analyzed: thob par byed pa yang don byed nus pa'i dngos po la 'jig par byed pa yid do //
translated: And that which causes attainment is that which causes the ascertainment of a thing that is able to perform a function.

original: 'jig par byed pa yang 'jig pa'i yul ston par byed pa tsam mo //
analyzed: 'jig par byed pa yang 'jig pa'i yul ston par byed pa tsam mo //
translated: And that which causes ascertainment is merely that which reveals the object of ascertainment.

original: de la 'jig pa'i yul bstan na shes pas skyes bus bcug cing don yang thob par @256a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig pa'i yul bstan na shes pas skyes bus bcug cing don yang thob par @256a * //
translated: When the object of ascertainment is revealed, the person engages in it and attains the object.

original: byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma bya ba rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: byed pa yin pa'i phyir tshad ma bya ba rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the function of a valid cognition is complete.

original: des thob par byed pa nyid las gzhan pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa ni med la /
analyzed: des thob par byed pa nyid las gzhan pa'i tshad ma'i byed pa ni med la /
translated: There is no function of a valid cognition other than causing attainment.

original: shes pa'i thob par byed pa yang 'jug par byed pa las gzhan ma yin zhing 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang yul rab tu ston pa las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i thob par byed pa yang 'jug par byed pa las gzhan ma yin zhing 'jug par byed pa nyid kyang yul rab tu ston pa las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: And the cause of the obtainment of knowledge is not different from the cause of engagement, and the cause of engagement is not different from the cause of the manifestation of the object.

original: de lta yin dang mngon sum gyis 'jug pa'i yul ston pa ni 'jug pa'i yul zhen par byed pa yin la rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i yul nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mngon sum gyis 'jug pa'i yul ston pa ni 'jug pa'i yul zhen par byed pa yin la rjes su dpag pa ni 'jug pa'i yul nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the manifestation of the object of engagement by direct perception is the cause of the apprehension of the object of engagement, and inference is the cause of the ascertainment of the object of engagement.

original: de lta na yang 'di la ni med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i stobs kyis rtogs pa'i phyi rol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di la ni med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po mthong ba'i stobs kyis rtogs pa'i phyi rol rjes su dpag par bya ba'i don yod pa nyid do zhes nges pa yin la /
translated: Even so, in this case, the existence of the external object to be inferred is ascertained by the power of seeing the invariable relation between it and the evidence.

original: mngon sum ni mthong bzhin pa'i dngos po med na mi 'byung ba 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa des na nges par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni mthong bzhin pa'i dngos po med na mi 'byung ba 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa des na nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: But direct perception does not ascertain it, because it does not precede the apprehension of the invariable relation between the object being perceived and the evidence.

original: ma zhen pa la ni mngon sum gyis 'jug par byed mi nus pas zhen pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma zhen pa la ni mngon sum gyis 'jug par byed mi nus pas zhen pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: And since direct perception cannot engage an object that is not apprehended, apprehension itself is the cause of engagement.

original: zhen pa'i mthar thug pa chad ma'i bya ba yin pa na yang zhen pa'i yul gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum gyi yin no //
analyzed: zhen pa'i mthar thug pa chad ma'i bya ba yin pa na yang zhen pa'i yul gang yin pa de nyid mngon sum gyi yin no //
translated: The object of the final stage of the adherence is the object of the direct perception.

original: zhen pa yang ldog pa'i yul can yin la /
analyzed: zhen pa yang ldog pa'i yul can yin la /
translated: Adherence is a subject that has an object of reversal.

original: ldog pa yang ldog mtshams kyi dbye bas tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa yang ldog mtshams kyi dbye bas tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Reversal is different by the division of the limit of reversal.

original: des na dngos po gcig gi ldog pas gang ji snyed pa de mtha' dag rnam par rtog pa gcig gi yul du byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: des na dngos po gcig gi ldog pas gang ji snyed pa de mtha' dag rnam par rtog pa gcig gi yul du byed par mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, by the reversal of one thing, one cannot make all that exists the object of a single thought.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi sgra la sgra nyid du zhen gyi skad cig ma nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mngon sum gyi sgra la sgra nyid du zhen gyi skad cig ma nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, with regard to the word direct perception, one adheres to sound itself, but not to momentariness.

original: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pas ni gdon mi za bar ldog pa gcig bdag gir bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rnam par rtog pas ni gdon mi za bar ldog pa gcig bdag gir bya ba yin la /
translated: If that is so, then conceptual thought must take one reversal as its own.

original: ldog pa gzhan dag la ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: ldog pa gzhan dag la ni nges pa med do //
translated: But there is no certainty with regard to other reversals.

original: ldog pa gcig pa 'dzin pa gdon mi za bar bya ba yin pas na rnam par rtog pa ni ldog pa gcig zhen pa'i byed pa can yin la /
analyzed: ldog pa gcig pa 'dzin pa gdon mi za bar bya ba yin pas na rnam par rtog pa ni ldog pa gcig zhen pa'i byed pa can yin la /
translated: Since it is necessary to take the one reversal, conceptual thought has the function of adhering to one reversal.

original: mngon sum yang rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa can yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum yang rnam par rtog pa'i byed pa can yin no //
translated: Direct perception also has the function of conceptualization.

original: des na tshad ma'i byed pa ni ldog pa gcig zhen par byed pa'i mthar thug pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tshad ma'i byed pa ni ldog pa gcig zhen par byed pa'i mthar thug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the function of valid cognition is the final determination of the apprehension of a single negation.

original: de lta yin dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa las ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa las ldog pa yin la /
translated: If that were the case, then what is called ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is the negation of impermanent,

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni don bya ba mi byed pa las ldog pa yin pas tshad mas byed pa gcig gi yul ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni don bya ba mi byed pa las ldog pa yin pas tshad mas byed pa gcig gi yul ma yin no //
translated: and what is called ‚Äúexistent‚Äù is the negation of that which does not perform a function. Therefore, they are not the objects of a single function of valid cognition.

original: des na tshad ma'i byed pa tha dad pa'i yul mngon sum gyi grub pa yod pa dag pa nyid gtan tshigs su len to //
analyzed: des na tshad ma'i byed pa tha dad pa'i yul mngon sum gyi grub pa yod pa dag pa nyid gtan tshigs su len to //
translated: Thus, the existence of the establishment of direct perception, which is the object of a different function of valid cognition, is taken as the reason.

original: @256b tshad ma'i byed pa gzhan gyi yul du gyur pa rtag pa nyid ni ci 'thad dam 'on te mi 'thad ces dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: @256b tshad ma'i byed pa gzhan gyi yul du gyur pa rtag pa nyid ni ci 'thad dam 'on te mi 'thad ces dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: It should be analyzed whether permanence, which is the object of another function of valid cognition, is tenable or not.

original: tshad ma'i byed pa la mi mkhas pa gzhan gyis ni rtag pa dang yod pa dag tshad ma gcig gi yul du bzung nas brtsad pa des na de bsal bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma'i byed pa la mi mkhas pa gzhan gyis ni rtag pa dang yod pa dag tshad ma gcig gi yul du bzung nas brtsad pa des na de bsal bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Others who are unskilled in the function of valid cognition, having taken permanence and existence as the object of a single valid cognition, argue about it. Therefore, it should be refuted.

original: gang yang ngo shes pa'i mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid la gnod do zhes bya ba la de yang dpyad dgos so //
analyzed: gang yang ngo shes pa'i mngon sum gyi skad cig ma nyid la gnod do zhes bya ba la de yang dpyad dgos so //
translated: But that is also to be examined.

original: 'di la gang zhig mngon sum gyi stobs las byung ba'i zhen pas don 'di ni ngas bzung ngo zhes bya ba nyid du zhen par byas pa de nyid mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i don du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig mngon sum gyi stobs las byung ba'i zhen pas don 'di ni ngas bzung ngo zhes bya ba nyid du zhen par byas pa de nyid mngon sum gyis bzung ba'i don du brjod do //
translated: Here, that very thing which is conceived by the adherence that arises from the power of perception, that is, ‚ÄúI have perceived this object,‚Äù is said to be the object perceived by perception.

original: gang zhig don 'di bzung ngo zhes shes par ma byas pa de ni mngon sum gyis bzung bar mi brtag ste /
analyzed: gang zhig don 'di bzung ngo zhes shes par ma byas pa de ni mngon sum gyis bzung bar mi brtag ste /
translated: But that which is not known to be the object perceived, that is not imagined to be perceived by perception.

original: de lta yin na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar gyur dang rim dang cig shos kyi rang bzhin la cig car yang rim gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then the sequential and nonsequential natures would be simultaneous and sequential, respectively.

original: de lta na gnyis ka la yang phan tshun gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu mtshan can don bya ba yang yod par thal bar 'gyur na rang bzhin nam don bya ba mthong ba yang med de /
analyzed: de lta na gnyis ka la yang phan tshun gyi rang bzhin dmigs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi rgyu mtshan can don bya ba yang yod par thal bar 'gyur na rang bzhin nam don bya ba mthong ba yang med de /
translated: In that case, it would follow that both would be observed to have the nature of the other, and both would have the nature of the cause of the other, but neither is seen to have the nature of the other or to be the cause of the other.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: rim dang cig car ni mi slu ba @258b dang ldan par re re'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis dmigs so //
analyzed: rim dang cig car ni mi slu ba @258b dang ldan par re re'i bdag nyid mngon sum gyis dmigs so //
translated: The order and simultaneity are perceived by direct perception as having the nature of each one.

original: de lta yin dang snang ba'i rim dang cig car gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di 'dra ba'i rim dang cig car dag gis gcig par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang snang ba'i rim dang cig car gang yin pa de dag ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yin pas 'di 'dra ba'i rim dang cig car dag gis gcig par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then whatever order and simultaneity there is in the appearance, they have the nature of mutual difference, so how could they be the same by having such order and simultaneity?

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i rang bzhin tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because things that are different by nature have the characteristic of being different.

original: 'di 'dra ba ma yin na ni rim dang cig car nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba ma yin na ni rim dang cig car nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were not like that, they would not be order and simultaneity.

original: de ltar gyur dang gang cung zad mthong ba'am brtags pa'i rang bzhin gnyis po ni rang bzhin de dag dang ldan pa'i mi srid pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur dang gang cung zad mthong ba'am brtags pa'i rang bzhin gnyis po ni rang bzhin de dag dang ldan pa'i mi srid pa kho na'o //
translated: If that were the case, then whatever is seen or examined, the two natures are absolutely impossible to have those natures.

original: de bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma rang bzhin gnyis yongs su gcod par nus pa nyid rim dang rim ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa'i rnam pa med pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum gyi tshad ma rang bzhin gnyis yongs su gcod par nus pa nyid rim dang rim ma yin pa dag las gzhan pa'i rnam pa med pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, direct perception is capable of ascertaining the two natures, and there is no other mode of ascertaining them besides sequential and non-sequential.

original: de lta yin dang rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don bya ba byed pa nyid la khyab pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rim dang rim ma yin pa dag gis don bya ba byed pa nyid la khyab pa grub pa'o //
translated: If that is so, then the pervasion of performing a function by sequential and non-sequential is established.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la ni rim dang rim ma yin pa'i mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid la ni rim dang rim ma yin pa'i mi 'thad do ;
translated: But for what is not momentary, sequential and non-sequential are not tenable.

original: /'di ltar dngos po rnams ni rang gi rang bzhin gyis don bya ba la nye bar sbyor ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'di ltar dngos po rnams ni rang gi rang bzhin gyis don bya ba la nye bar sbyor ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it will be explained that things are engaged in performing their function by their own nature.

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni 'bras bu skyed pas nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa de ni 'bras bu skyed pas nus pa yin no //
translated: Because the existence of the effect's conformity and non-conformity with what is present and absent is the capacity to produce the effect.

original: 'bras bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rjes su byas pa yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te des na rang bzhin nyid nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pas rjes su byas pa yang dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin te des na rang bzhin nyid nus pa yin no //
translated: The nature of things is also that the effect is produced in accordance with the presence or absence of the cause, and so nature itself is potency.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni skad cig dang po yang nye ba yin pa /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyis skad cig gnyis par 'byung ba'i 'bras bu'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni skad cig dang po yang nye ba yin pa /
translated: The nature of a nonmomentary thing that produces an effect in the second moment is also present in the first moment.

original: de'i phyir skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i tshogs gang yin pa de skad cig dang por yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu'i tshogs gang yin pa de skad cig dang por yang skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the collection of effects that are produced in the second moment and so on would also be produced in the first moment.

original: de ltar yin dang skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang skad cig ma ma yin pa la rim pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If that were so, it would not be tenable that a nonmomentary thing has a sequential activity.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par sgrub par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag ni skad cig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis ltos par bya ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag tu yang lhan cig ma yinüîΩpar bshad zin to //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i khyad par sgrub par mi nus pa'i rang bzhin lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dag ni skad cig pa ma yin pa'i don gyis ltos par bya ba mi 'thad do zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag tu yang lhan cig ma yin par bshad zin to //
translated: The nature of the conditions that are not different from each other cannot be established as different or not different. Since they are not momentary, it is untenable that they are dependent.üîΩThis has already been explained elsewhere as not being simultaneous.

original: des na 'dir mi spro'o //üîΩ'di snyam du 'du byed skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa dag la ni rang las skye ba'i 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car @259a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir mi spro'o // 'di snyam du 'du byed skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa dag la ni rang las skye ba'i 'bras bu mtha' dag cig car @259a * //
translated: Therefore, it will not be elaborated here.

original: skyed par byed do snyam na de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skyed par byed do snyam na de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: If one thinks that with respect to non-momentary formations, all effects that are produced from themselves are produced simultaneously, that is also untenable.

original: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa des skad cig dang por cung zad rang gi bdag nyid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par yang skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa des skad cig dang por cung zad rang gi bdag nyid kyis bskyed par bya ba'i 'bras bu ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par yang skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being non-momentary, whatever effects are produced by it in the first moment, all of that is also produced in the second moment and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i tshogs sgrub par rung ba'i bdag nyid de ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yang nye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tshogs sgrub par rung ba'i bdag nyid de ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs pa dag na yang nye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is suitable to be the self-entity of the assembly of results, it is near in the second moment and so on.

original: des nas 'di rnam grangs skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa las khyab par byed pa med pas de las bzlog pa na skad cig
analyzed: des nas 'di rnam grangs skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed par mi 'thad pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig ma nyid ma yin pa las khyab par byed pa med pas de las bzlog pa na skad cig
translated: Therefore, it is not a different category from momentariness because it is not tenable that it performs a function either gradually or instantaneously. Since there is no pervader that is not momentary, the opposite of that is pervaded by momentariness.

original: ma nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ma nyid kyis khyab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: This is a natural inference.

original: rigs pa pa chen po lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib ma lus pa 'joms par mdzad pa sa'i steng na rgyal ba'i mdzad pa la de nyid gnyis par gyur pa /
analyzed: rigs pa pa chen po lta ba ngan pa'i rab rib ma lus pa 'joms par mdzad pa sa'i steng na rgyal ba'i mdzad pa la de nyid gnyis par gyur pa /
translated: The great logician, who completely destroys the cataracts of bad views, who is second to the Victor in performing the deeds of the Victor on the face of the earth,

original: dpal slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i legs par bshad pa mchog gis thugs yongs su rgyas pa tshul khrims rin po che dang / rtsom pa dam pa'i rgyan dang go chas rnam par mdzes shing mi bzlogs pa'i chos can /
analyzed: dpal slob dpon chos kyi grags pa'i legs par bshad pa mchog gis thugs yongs su rgyas pa tshul khrims rin po che dang / rtsom pa dam pa'i rgyan dang go chas rnam par mdzes shing mi bzlogs pa'i chos can /
translated: The one whose mind is completely filled with the excellent explanations of the glorious master Dharmakirti, who is adorned with the armor of the ornament of true composition, who is endowed with the quality of being unassailable,

original: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba skad cig ma 'jig pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba skad cig ma 'jig pa grub pa zhes bya ba'i rab tu byed pa rdzogs so /
translated: the master Dharmakirti, has completed the treatise called Proof of Momentariness.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po skal ldan rgyal po dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po skal ldan rgyal po dang / lo ts'a ba dge slong blo ldan shes rab kyis bsgyur ba'o//
